divs: Sighting Detailsat very close to 8pm EST I observed a "greenish-white" illuminated ball descending from my location (40 28'48.63"N 79 34'39.33"W) NNW direction. duration of event was about 15 seconds - it may have been visible longer but I was looking at a different direction (towards Venus?) then looked NNW and saw illuminated light descending. Rate was not rapid (but too fast to be a flare, and no report from firework heard) - I saw it descend about 15 degrees at least in terms of the arc of the sky - almost straight down. No trail visible behind fireball - there was still a little light on the western horizon, maybe that obscured a trail. Ball had a "halo" around it - VERY light clouds visible in that direction. Was several times brighter than venus.
